threats.title: Developer commits secret
threats.description:
A developer commits a secret to the source code repository, intentionally or not.
Anyone with read access can obtain the secret and use it to exploit user data
threats.mitigation:
Use a Vault to handle secrets.
Follow the the principle of least privilege 
Follow the principle of need to know, so secrets for production are not known by developers

threats.title: Developer Laptop Stolen/Compromised
threats.description:
Developer laptop stolen, hard drive is not encrypted.
Attacker gains commit access to repo and ssh access to systems the dev has access to
threats.mitigation:
Encrypt all hard drives
Follow Least Privilege principle
Verify all devices are attached to the correct domain
Run endpoint protection on all devices (Crowdstrike)

threats.title: Developer adds malicious package
threats.description: Developer adds malicious package to the project, creating a backdoor into the codebase
threats.mitigation:
Ensure PR is needed for all merge requests, requiring multiple approvals
Create policy that ensures packages must only come from approved sources
Build tooling into CI pipeline which identifies non sanctioned packages and repositories
Enable service operation threat detection such as GuardDuty

threats.title: Rogue Employee is used to find unpatched internal systems.
threats.description: A rogue employee is used to detect unpatched internal systems.
threats.mitigation:
Add vulnerability scans to detect unpatched vulnerabilities 
Perform background checks on all employees
Segregate network and follow Least Privilege principle
Harden version control system

threats.title: Compromised Open Source Dependency
threats.description: An open source dependency gets compromised.
threats.mitigation:
Enable automated dependency analysis to check for compromised dependencies
Fix and stabilise dependency versions in a policy enabled BOM
Enable service operation threat detection such as GuardDuty 
Create policy that ensures packages must only come from approved sources
Build tooling into CI pipeline which identifies non sanctioned packages and repositories

threats.title: Developer Access to Container Registry
threats.description: Developer access to container registry. Compromised images can be inserted into the deployment process.
threats.mitigation:
Enable full logging of push/pull operations for the registry
Seperate container registries for development and production targets
Restrict production container registry access to the CI/CD pipeline
Implement image signing and verification
